review: I loved the shape. It makes it easy to get into hard to reach places, and even though I was worried about the long tip being flimsy, I had enough control when using it under my eyes. And the bottom is perfect for the normal bouncing method of the rest of the face. There are definitely enough different areas to apply different cream products, like blush, bronzer, concealer, etc without mixing them. The thing that gives me mixed feelings about this sponge is the texture and material. I am used to the soft squishy sponges that feel very light. This sponge is hard, dense, and almost rubbery. Even though it expands when wet and used damp, it doesn't get softer. I could hear and feel it hitting my face when using it, which was not very enjoyable. The other thing this texture does is soak up products. I have to apply many layers of product because the first time or two i get almost no product on my actual face. It is all just soaked up into the sponge. I can get a flawless airbrushed coverage after 3-4 layers of product because it's already saturated with product. It seems wasteful and annoying since my other sponges don't do that. Plus it wastes time when I'm in a hurry. It is also annoying that each section of the sponge has to be essentially primed like this, soaking it in product, before being used. If I use the flat end of the sponge for foundation, I then have to use multiple layers of concealer too, because that concealer portion of the sponge soaks it all up. I can't even just use the big side for concealer because it is too big for around my nose and eyes. Other sponges you can use the big sides for small spaces just by squishing them a bit, but this revlon one can't be squished into areas, you just have to use the pointy side, which as I said, then needs to be primed with more product wasted.
